definition: to be made to stand still as a punishment
station/to stand/to halt/to stop/branch of a company or organization/website

sentences.english: But it was their choice to stand in the corner.
sentences.chinese: 不過，去牆角罰站是他們自己選擇的。

sentences.english: As Tom to bring his course book, so he was made to stand outside the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 由於湯姆忘了帶教科書，故被罰站在教室外。

sentences.english: If the answer wrong, on the stand.
I had to stand by a wall for 10 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 我因此而被面牆罰站10分鐘。

sentences.english: Thursday, Charles had to stay in the corner during story time because he kept beating his feet on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 星期四，查爾斯由於在上課時跺腳，被罰站在角落裏。

sentences.english: They rebelled against being forced to stand in the footprints when they made mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 他們對出錯就要罰站的做法很牴觸。

sentences.english: Instead of humiliating bad workers, they now encourage the best ones to stand in the footprints for recognition.
sentences.chinese: 他們取消了出錯罰站，而是在那裏表揚優秀員工。

sentences.english: It's not right for children to sit up late .
sentences.chinese: 讓遲到的孩子罰站是不對的。

sentences.english: Sent to stand in the corner, he makes faces for his classmates and writes a lament on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 站在角落罰站時，他又做鬼臉，在牆上寫詩罵老師。

sentences.english: Eventually, it will sink in that if he misbehaves , he'll get a time-out.
sentences.chinese: 最後，如果他做的不對，他就會得到一次“罰站”。

sentences.english: Hardly any of the windows are left standing.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎沒有任何窗口罰站。

definition: to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
to run around all over the place
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to follow bad examples/to be corrupted by bad examples
to have a close call/to have a narrow escape
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
